quark_ponders.ponder.minecraft_chain.tex: Chains can now connect blocks together when a piston moves them
As you can see, the chain block itself doesn't have to be moved by the piston, and will attach indirectly to other moved blocks.
Chains will only connect to blocks if they do so visually.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_chute.text_1:
The Chute is a new automation block.
This is NOT a hopper!
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_chute.text_2: Items can be inserted into it via automation (Hopper, Dropper, etc)
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_chute.text_3: Any items inserted are instantly dropped under it, always precisely in the center.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_chute.text_4: The Chute can be disabled with a redstone signal..
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_chute.text_5: Placing a block under it disables it too.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_chute.text_6:
The Chute can drop items through hollow logs.
(Any block with a hole in the middle)
quark_ponders.ponder.minecraft_dispenser: Dispensers are allowed to place blocks in the world.
Any blocks that already had a placement behaviour, like TNT, are ignored.
The blocks are rotated so they're placed forward from the dispenser.
Note that crops such as Wheat Seeds or Potatoes also count.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_ender_watcher: The Ender Watcher is a new redstone input block.
It emits a redstone signal if a player is looking directly at it.
The signal is higher the closer to the center of the block the player is looking.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_feeding_troug: The Feeding Trough is a new block that can hold animal food in it.
While holding the correct food, it will attract and breed animals from %s blocks around it.
There's a chance the animal will need more than one bit of food to get in love mode.
If there's more than %s animals in a %d block radius, the animals will eat, but never enter love mode.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_gravisand.tex:
Gravisand is a new sand variant.
It will not fall unless primed with redstone.
However, if gravisand receives a signal, and can not fall, it'll instead float up.
Gravisand will propagate the signal to any adjacent gravisand blocks, causing them to fall or float as well.
Gravisand always outputs a comparator signal of 15.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_iron_rod.head: Iron Rod
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_iron_rod.text: Pistons pushing an Iron Rod will have it work as a drill of sorts.
An Iron Rod will break any blocks in front of it.
Iron Rods will only break blocks that pistons can push.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_metal_buttons: Gold and Iron buttons draw influence from Weighted Pressure Plates.

Gold Buttons emit a very short pulse.
(2 redstone ticks)

Iron Buttons emit a very long pulse.
(5 seconds)
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_obsidian_pres: Pressure Plates made with obsidian will only trigger when Players walk over them.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_piston_move_t:
Pistons are allowed to move Tile Entities.
(Blocks with extra data attached, like Chests or Furnaces)
Attempting to move a block to an invalid position will cause it to break and drop its contents
For a block that pistons can't move, now that furnaces can't be used, look into Sturdy Stone in the Building category.
Note that some blocks such as Monster Spawners can't be moved this way, so you don't go and break the game!
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_redstone_rand: The Randomizer is a new redstone component.
When given a redstone signal from the back, it'll randomly enable either the left or right output.
